text: The workers at the Clanton U.S.P.S. are always friendly and help.

name: Donald Gulledge
text:
This is NOT the address for the Clanton Post Office.
This is the Old address of the Clanton Post Office which was purchased by the city of Clanton & now the current Location of Clanton city Police Department.
Current location of Clanton Post Office is off of 6th Street listed as U.S. Post Office

name: Boosted 4doorEg
text: Always get in and out super quick

name: Marie E
text: There was only one employee. The line and wait were far beyond reasonable! The one employee, a tall bald man, was extremely rude. I had a passport appointment, and he used his phone during the time he was taking my picture. Also, he was hasty and rushed me. He did not mention or suggest anything about priority or express mail or insurance. He lost my application at one point during the process. He told me to write on the form to correct it, when the dept. of state explicitly says NOT to write on the form. When I told him that, he said something to the effect of, "Trust me, I've been doing this for years, and I took the all day class. I know what I'm doing." With a sharp tongue. My application never made it to the dept., and it is now lost with my original birth certificate and a check I had to pay to void, with no way to track it's whereabouts. Absolutely horrible. Id give them -5 stars if I could.

name: George William
text: I’ve lived all over the country. This post office is the absolute worst ever. Soooooooo slow and the employees are clueless. I can only imagine the sight if these workers had jobs where they had to produce. They also need to update their posted hours. I was here on a Saturday right after 8:30 because online it states 8:30. However their window shows 9:00 and of course they didn’t unlock the door until EXACTLY 9:00 in spite of a line waiting outside.

name: Reme lopes
text:
Positive this place is stealing packages
I’ve had two packages say attempted deliver but that they didn’t have access to my apartment building
For three days in a row now, my packages are gone.

My apartment building is never locked and doesn’t even have a lock on it.
Today Saturday was their “ attempted re delivery “ for all of my packages ( sep order)
And no one even showed up.
Also yay me it’s Saturday they said they re delivered around 7 pm which is coincidental that tomorrow they are closed and already closed today.

I will be calling to people above them, to get this area reported.

name: jeffrey mathis
text: Our residence, 3257 Monte Doro Dr, 35216 has had no delivery of mail since Wed., June 2 through Sat., June 5. That's 4 days. I will attempt to be in someone's ear about this.

name: Paul Goodall (PrincePaul)
text:
I scheduled a passport appointment on 1/21/2021.  The appointment was confirmed to take place at 10:00am on 1/26/2021.  I arrived 10 minutes early on the 26th as directed and was informed that... "The guy who does passports isn't here today.  He said he was going to call everyone who had an appointment and let them know.  They called me to come open the store.  I'm not even supposed to be here.  You can wait if you want but usually if he was coming in, he would already be here."

Obviously, I left.

I had to leave work for this appointment and now I'll have to leave again on the 28th... to go to a different location, of course.  You may rest assured I received no call from this man.  You may also rest assured that this place deserves even less than the 1.9 stars they have earned for themselves.

name: Kirsten Ratza
text: I am quite frustrated with this post office. I had a package marked as delivered that never appeared at my home. Now, three weeks later, the same thing has happened again. Another package is marked as delivered but has not appeared.  What is happening to this service?  I would rather have slower but accurate service then missing mail.  Please, if someone of any authority reads this, figure out what is happening to this vital service! We rely on you to do good work.

name: notthebeesxoxo
text: Slow with usually only one person working the entire office. If they are tied up doing passports, they will tell you they can't help you. They have lines out the door of people with one person working always. They will also set out hand written signs that say they will be back later, leaving the doors unlocked and the office completely open with no one in it.

name: Kristen W.
text: I was wary of visiting because all the reviews are bad but it was a good experience. There was a line but Lakita was pleasant and efficient.

name: peter rambin
text: Amazon package not delivered for no apparent reason. Just says held at location and gives me the address for the vestavia post office. Obviously I'm already frustrated since I paid for delivery. I go there and ask if my package is there and the man working very rudely starts cutting me off and telling me I don't have a p.o. box there he doesn't have my package and that it's at green springs location. That's fine and dandy, but could he not tell me nicely it, even in a neutral tone? Why did it set this guy off and why could he not conduct himself like an adult to tell me this? He also appeared to have a nicer shirt in than the other employee as if he might be in charge/the manager which is insane given how he acted like a child. Based on these reviews I'm not alone with incredibly incompetent and rude staff.

name: Kenneth Carden
text: Lazy. The bald guy here will cut corners if he can. Make them verify the address sent and also just go to another post office.

name: William Sellers
text: I don’t even review places but I had to leave this 1 star after my experience today.

name: jacob g
text: Declined service at 3:30 on a monday when no else was in store.

name: Melanie Taylor - Coleman
text: In and out in 5 minutes or less. The service was fine. Others complain about the long line. The newer post offices are much bigger. This little place can’t help but have a line. My issues is the building. This location is very old and dark. The location can also be hard to get in and out.

name: JIll Billions
text: This post office is unfortunately the slowest post office ever. The same employees have been there for ages and take their sweet time no matter how long the line is. Occasionally they’ll get a new or temp worker that is smiley and more proficient which is a breath of fresh air. I absolutely dread this post office and often drive farther to a different one. I’ve also mailed cards directly from here that were local and took over 2 weeks to arrive.

name: Jessica Gunter
text: Wouldn't make a copy of change of address to enroll a student as proof of address change for the new school ... school told me that the post office did actually what i needed went to a another post office and got what was needed for the school .... when they told me it would be 10 to 15 business days

name: Jenna Willoughby
text: Very disappointed with my attempted visits here. I had a passport appointment at 10:00 am (first appointment of the day) and when I came in they said all passport appointments had been canceled. She said they called everyone but I did not have a missed call. I scheduled an appointment for another day at 10:00 am. I went in and the man said they canceled all passport appointments again!! I did not have any missed calls, and the night before I received confirmations of my appointment. Not coming back.

name: Matt Burke
text: Friendly but not enough employees especially when they’re the busiest—during lunch hours.  Line is regularly out the door with only 1 employee at the register.

name: Jesse Carter
text: I was 5 min late for a passport appointment after driving 40 min away and having to wait in traffic. She said after 3 min your late and I can't help you. Like exceptions can't be made over 2 min? The past 3 usps ive been too have had awful service. Its like they hire way underqualified people to work there that don't understand what line of work they are in. The answer is customer service by the way. They need to take some training courses to learn how to service people. Mcdonalds has better customer service.

name: Shaun Thomas
text: I called because a package was attempted for delivery to my business and a "notice" was supposedly left because we were closed. There was no notice to be found, and the carrier did not show up the next day to redeliver. The phone number online is a fax line, so no luck calling to get anyone on the line to explain. I've had other similar experiences here in person where employees couldn't be any less concerned with helping customers. I also have had packages taken without being given tracking information after asking for it. Hate having to deal with this office.

name: Adaryl Mines
text: One of the letter carriers rear ended my car not paying attention at a stop light. It's going on 2months and they still haven't called me or my insurance agent back about the repairs my car needs. When you call all you get is the run around and directed to a claims lady that is never in her office nor does she return phone calls.

name: Nikki Aaron
text: A family had an appointment to get passports. Instead of having two desk workers to cover the appointment and regular business, these morons sent the second employee on a long break. So a long line of customers had to wait and wait to get our business handled. I'm so glad we spend all our tax revenue on war instead of on making the government run smoothly.

name: Katie R
text:
I have never used this post office location, as it is not really near my home or work but it was convenient to me yesterday to purchase stamps and mail my Christmas Cards.  This location was by far the most personable I have been to in many many visits.  There was a line out the door but the two clerks working the registers stayed calm and friendly the entire time, even when the system went down and quit taking credit/debit cards.  They were friendly and patient and it was truly a nice experience despite the wait in line.  They were efficient and methodical as well.  Often times at other locations I feel as though the clerks are attempting to see just how SLOWLY they can process everybody in line.

Job well done, despite your location not being convenient to me, I wouldn't mind making the drive just to have this good of service from a postal service office.

name: Stina Journey
text: I tried calling about getting a passport and the lady didn't even care. I am new to the area and didn't know about the walk-in building. I had to ask her about the address for the walk-in building and she quickly told me. I asked about the times they were opened. She quickly told me with a very bad "I'm better than you" voice and hung up. I didn't even get to ask about the application or what forms of ID I needed to bring. I'm definitely not calling back or wanting to be a customer.

name: Seble abadi
text: Worst place to do business at. The staffs are horrible. It’s a place you wouldn’t want to go back again!

name: Marcus Ross
text: Slowest. Post Office. Ever.

name: Christian Mays
text: This post office and the post office downtown were rated some of the United States fastest post offices. Heck yes. My packages have never been late. It's pretty incredible.

text: Took forever to get on the phone & when answered was rushed to get off. Tried to pass me off to the main office several times. I recommend going to the UAB location. They were very nice AND efficient

name: Arnold Servo
text: The single worst experience I had at an USPS office!  I was "served" by Mrs. Joanne Simmons.  It became evident pretty quickly that this lady couldn't care less about working at this office or to fulfill the most minimal and basic duties this government paid job requires.  Admittedly, there might be other great service providers / employees at this facility, but the fact that the disrespectful and incompetent behavior of a person like Joanne Simmons is tolerated there, makes me doubt that this is the case.

name: Richard McCallum
text: Plan to wait at least 10 to 30 minutes if you need to see someone at the counter. You would figure that they would have full staff on busy days like April and October 15th. It seems like every time that their is a deadline, the line is out the door and there is only one person at the counter.

name: Daniel Ford
text: Going to the post office is never fun, but it's not their fault that the lines are long. I've never had anything other than a positive experience here, and I ship packages for my business regularly

name: Tiffany Roberts
text: This is the slowest post office anywhere around. There's only ever 1 cashier and a ton of people in line. It's worth the hassle to just drive to Hoover where they actually have multiple employees and it doesn't take 20 minutes to mail a single package.

name: Dee X

name: Sharon Worcester

There are two women in there at the counter who are the most rude and obnoxious people. I don't think it's right for them to behave that way when people.go in there and spend their money to send cards off to loved ones for the holidays. It doesn't matter what day it is or what it's for. They do not have the right to treat people horrible or ruin their day. They need to rethink their attitudes or  go find another job that does not require talking to patrons.

Hey, I was in there today around 4:30 April 10th. Firstly. I'm sorry if I was out of place with anything I said while I was in there, I wasn't  trying to make the situation worse at all....
Secondly,  your whole staff is incredible.  You are all very nice and kind and helpful. I just hope I didnt make the situation worse with anything I said.  I know you all try your best every day and it shows! Thank you for your kind service to the oneonta community!

text: THE PEOPLE IN POST OFFICE  IN ONEONTA AL ARE REAL NICE THAT IS WHAT MAKES  A REAl Great post office friendly faces always good .so good to you  it's like 0 so good BarBQ its so good to see some being good to you.you it makes you to want back and buy their steamps or say Hi How you doing you go to out for a veggie pizza at pizza Hut

text: Really bad experience! I ordered some medications I needed for this Friday, I ordered on last Monday it was delivered on Thursday to the wrong address, I went to the post office, they took my number, the delivery man just told me “Maybe one of your neighbors has your package, I think I put it in the wrong mail box” it has been happening a lot lately on my apartments complex because I went to the apartments office to see if my package was delivered there, and they said some neighbors complained about the same experience. I hope they be more carefully about people package.

name: Curt Brewer
text:
***** UPDATE 10/17/2018 *****

I have noticed that many personal items of mail that we receive to our P.O. Box have been ripped as if someone has looked in on it.

Please stop this!!!

It happens to most of the items that look like they may be a "Check" or a "Financial Item."

Please, Gulf Shores Post Office, Please look into this.  It happens a lot in the past year.

------------------
End of new review
------------------

I have read several reviews from this place, and people have rated it low. I've seen the volume they do in this post office, and I'm surprised at how patient they can actually be with the amount of people that come through. The building and the property leave a few things to be desired, but for the most part, everybody here is nice and friendly and they do try to help you to the best of their ability!

name: SE Editor
text: Edward provided excellent customer service. He was fast, friendly and efficient as he weighed and prepared postage for the 45 boxes we were sending across the United States. Keep up the good work Edward and Gulf Shores Postal Service.

name: Cody Cothren
text: Everytime i use the post office here everyone is friendly. As someone who uses the post office a lot I know that the Gulf Shores office is one of the better offices around. They have a high volume of customers and mail. Prices are set by congess. Tax dollars are not used, the post office funds itself. Put yourself in the employees shoes dealing with customers that have messed up addresses or came to complain to them and they had nothing to do with that situation, but they listen and try and help. I know I would be a little frustrated sometimes too. Just a thought. Maybe it will make the experience better if you don't come in blaming everyone and just ask for help instead. Most of the negative comments i have read on here are just people whining because they didn't get exactly what they wanted and chances are they didn't pay to get it either. The post office has premium services for just about everything from special handling to restricted. You just have to be willing to pay for the service or properly wrap the items.

name: connie lopez
text: The post office staff from the Postmaster to those that work at the counter in Gulf Shores are always so helpful and very pleasant.

name: Nancy Pfaff
text: Staff is always helpful and patient 😀

name: Stefanie Stortz
text: A big shout out to Dixie and Roger at thr Gulf Shores location. I had a problem today and they worked fast and fixed it on a Saturday!! Thank you so much!!

name: Thomas Davison
text: Would not recommend this post office, Not vacationer friendly. Will not hand out General delivery mail except on Thursday and Friday between the hours of 2pm till 4pm. Called and talked to Postmaster and he stated that they would rather have you rent a P.O. box instead of using General Delivery. They would rather make the money off of P.O. box instead of the inconvenience of general delivery. Now I understand why the post office is going under. Lack of customer service. I explained to the post master it might be a good idea to post the general delivery rules somewhere so people will know. It sounded like he didn't care. Will be using UPS stores in the future.

name: Niconico nii
text: My favorite post office. Go early. It gets packed quick.

name: Jane Randolph
text: Suzanne was so helpful even though it was my error on packages that were addressed incorrectly. Thank you Gulf Shores Post Office.

name: Sean Nichol
text: Every single time my wife or I come in there which is often since we buy and sell a lot on eBay. These people are always so rude and act very inconvenienced. They charge me twice what UPS does for a simple padded envelope. I will no longer be using this post office ever again.

name: Sofia Rivera
text: Doesn't matter what the package is labeled with, my lights always come broken. I can't get these reptile bulbs local so I have to order online, only they are usually damaged in shipping even with big labels saying "GLASS BE CAREFUL". Now I have to find someone to drive to since I've been waiting for reshipments of the same product, only to arrive once again broken. Very displeased and will avoid from now on.
